common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application Bugs Reported by Users
common_issues.description: Users reported various bugs in the Pieces Desktop Application across macOS and Windows. Issues include incorrect calendar day mapping in chat summaries, incomplete or incorrect code generation from LLMs, and inverted arrow key scrolling in Copilot conversations.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and implement fixes. Users should provide detailed steps to reproduce the issues and specify their OS and application versions.

related_issues.title: Problems with calendar days
related_issues.text:
Problems with calendar days
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using chat, I've notices in several occasions that when I ask something like "Give me a summary of what I did between May 2 and today", it always messes up the calendar days like saying "Monday - May 2" and it was a Friday. And its difficult to get it to properly give the date with the correct day "Monday, Tuesday, etc". Kind of makes me doubt if its actually saving and giving me the proper info of the dates for activities and everything.

related_issues.title: Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
related_issues.text:
Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Arrow keyboard input for up and down keys is inverted when using the keyboard to scroll through a Pieces Copilot conversation.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open Pieces Desktop (4.1.2 macOS in my case)
- Make sure to open Pieces Copilot view
- Open a conversation that's long enough to have overflow content in the chat window
- Click on the chat window or input box to make sure the focus is on the conversation (and not focused on the left-side conversation list)
- Use the up and down arrow keys to scroll through the conversation content.

Expected behaviour: Actually I'm a lifelong flight simulator gamer so I really don't mind the actual behaviour I'm getting, but I imagine the expected behaviour would be for down key to scroll down through the content and up key to scroll up.

Actual behaviour: Y-axis is inverted. I have to press up to scroll down through a conversation, and down key to scroll up.

common_issues.title: Pieces Software Bugs and LLM Code Generation Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces software, including the CLI's LTM feature not working, the VS Code extension's copy button endlessly loading, and LLMs not providing complete or correct code.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions for these diverse problems. Sharing logs and specific examples can help in troubleshooting.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Freezes and High CPU Usage
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop freezing after inactivity, especially after using chat, requiring a restart.  High CPU usage and slow performance are also observed, particularly on older macOS systems with Intel chipsets. Issues occur across different Pieces OS versions (11.3.6-11.4.1) and Desktop versions (4.1.2-4.1.3).  Large amounts of content in browser tabs may exacerbate the freezing issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.

When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: LTM Issues in Pieces OS and Desktop
common_issues.description: Users report problems with Long Term Memory (LTM) feature, including failure to clear LTM,  inaccurate context retrieval, and freezing after inactivity. Issues appear across Pieces Desktop and CLI on Windows.  Further investigation needed to identify root cause and solutions.  Users have tried clearing LTM via different methods without success.

related_issues.title: LTM does not clear
related_issues.text:
LTM does not clear
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I've been using LTM 2 since launch without clearing it. Such an improvement over LTM 1 with regards to time to first token. However, I have started to feel that ttft was getting longerand longer, even on supposedly faster LLMs. Even if built to recall 9 months worth of data, it might not be optimal, which is fair. Note that I have edited both the list of apps allowed to provide context, as well as checked apps to get context from within a chat. But to no improvement. So I tried tp clear the all time LTM. On Pieces Desktop, I do not get feedback when I click the clear button, but the dialog box disappears after a while. It takes some time. When checking if LTM has been cleared by asking a question about what I did in the morning or last week, the copilot would answer it correctly.  I conclude the LTM has not been cleared. I deleted the chat and tried to clear it via Pieces OS, got direct click feedback and after a while a confirmation message. Retried the copilot and it still has context. I suppose this is not expected behavior. By the way, using clouds LLMs.

Any ideas?

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop freezes after inactivity
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS - 11.4.1
Pieces Desktop - 4.1.3

Pieces desktop randomly freezes after a period of inactivity. I would interact with it in a chat, go back to working in another app and after a while go back to Desktop to find it had frozen. Restart of Pieces Desktop is needed. Note that this problem is very frequent since latest update on May 22nd, but not systematic. I had also noticed this kind of behavior before the updated but put it on the count of my Hardware, Intel i5, 16Gbram Asus Vivobook, but I think I can dismiss this theory.

Where it gets tricky is that this behavior seems to only happen if I had, prior to returning to Pieces Desktop, interacted with a chat. In cases where I simply had started Desktop, worked on something else and gone back to Desktop, it would keep working properly.

Noteworthy: LTM is enabled by default for all chats. Default LLM: Claude 3.7 Sonnet.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate and fix the LTM issues reported across Pieces OS, Desktop, and CLI. Prioritize the "LTM does not clear" issue (709) and the "LTM not working in Pieces CLI" issue (713).

Address the Pieces Desktop freezing and high CPU usage issues. Focus on the reports related to inactivity after chat usage (719) and large amounts of content in browser tabs (718). Investigate performance on older macOS systems with Intel chipsets (710).

Resolve the bugs in the Pieces Desktop Application, particularly the incorrect calendar day mapping in chat summaries (720), incomplete or incorrect code generation from LLMs (716), and inverted arrow key scrolling in Copilot conversations (714).
Investigate and fix the issue with the copy button endlessly loading in the VS Code extension (712).
Improve LLM code generation accuracy and completeness as reported in multiple tickets (716).  Gather more information from users about specific instances where the code is incorrect or incomplete.
Consider adding more detailed logging to Pieces OS and Desktop to better diagnose freezing and crashing issues.
Communicate to users the importance of providing detailed steps to reproduce issues, OS and application versions, and logs when reporting bugs.
Analyze the frequency of LLM-related issues (e.g., "Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model") and investigate potential solutions or workarounds.
